alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 2:55PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from excessive rainfall. Small stream flooding will continue through this evening. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and western Maine, including the following counties, in southwest Maine, Cumberland and York. In western Maine, Franklin and Oxford. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may be impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 253 PM EDT, Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Small streams will continue to rise through this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Conway, Farmington, Bridgton, Fryeburg, Mechanic Falls, Alfred, Bethel, Rumford, Naples and Turner.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
